title: Calories in a Sugar Spoon
meta_description: Discover calories in sugar spoon (1 tsp), plus carbs, sugars, full nutrition breakdown per serving, and easy tweaks for your recipes.
assumptions: Granulated white sugar; 1 level teaspoon (tsp) ≈4 g; no additives.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by sugar type (white, brown), granule size, packing level, and brand. Check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: One teaspoon of sugar provides about 16 kcal, all from carbs.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

faqs.q: How many calories in one sugar spoon?
faqs.a: About 16 kcal for 1 level teaspoon of granulated sugar.

faqs.q: Is sugar spoon calories from carbs?
faqs.a: Yes, all 16 kcal come from 4 g of carbohydrates (sugars).

faqs.q: What's the difference between tsp and tbsp sugar calories?
faqs.a: 1 tbsp is ≈48 kcal (3 tsp), so three times a teaspoon.

faqs.q: Does brown sugar have more calories per spoon?
faqs.a: Slightly—about 17 kcal per tsp due to minor molasses content.

faqs.q: Are there any fats or proteins in sugar spoon?
faqs.a: No—pure sugar is 0 g fat, 0 g protein, all carbs.
